comment.author: 65901644@N00
comment._content: This is an EMD NW2, built by General Motors' Electro-Motive Division in June, 1948. Its EMD serial number was 3170. It passed to the New York Central Railroad as #9502, later #8685, and became Penn Central #8685. It survived to be incorporated into Conrail as their #9265. All of this from www.trainweb.org/emdloco/3100.htm

comment.author: 41354729@N03
comment._content: Sister engine 116 can be seen repainted in O&W livery on the DURR tourist railroad in Arkville, NY.  It is still operates on special occasions.
